name: Cellpose Training
title: Cellpose Training
description: Training Neural network to segment cyto/nuclei
author: Sudharsan Prativadi(sudharsan.prativadi@labshare.org)
institution: National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences, National Institutes of Health
citation: Cellpose a generalist, deep learning-based segmentation algorithm which can very precisely segment a wide range of image types out-of-the-box and does not require model retraining or parameter adjustments, https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.02.02.931238v1

inputs.name: diameter
inputs.description: Default Diameter is 30 for cyto and 17 for nuclei. If diameter is 0 there will be no rescaling

inputs.name: inpDir
inputs.description: Input image collection to be processed by this plugin

inputs.name: cpretrainedModel
inputs.description: Select the custom pretrained model for segmentation

inputs.name: concatenation
inputs.description: Concatenate downsampled layers with upsampled layers (off by default which means they are added). Default False

ui.title: Input collection
ui.description: Input image collection to be processed by this plugin

ui.title: Model to use(Cyto/nuclei)
ui.description: Object that needs to be segmented

ui.title: Pretrained Model of choice
ui.description: Path to pretrained Model to run the images

ui.title: Vector field of Labelled images
ui.description: Path to zarr file. Output of Label to Vector plugin

ui.title: Use concatenation
ui.description: Concatenate downsampled layers with upsampled layers (off by default)
